titleStmt.title: John W. Finnell to Nathaniel Gaither, Jr.
CWG8334

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL.
KENTUCKY.
Head-Quarters Kentucky Volunteer Militia,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Frankfort, 29 March 1862.

Hon:
Nat Gaither Jr
Sec: of State
Sir
The following Officers have resigned viz:

Capt: Jesse Stepleton (date of Com: 22 Jan 1862)
Lieut: Joseph L Judy (date of Com: 26 Nov 1861)
Lieut: Wm G. Howard (date of Com: 21 Dec 1861)
Capt: Milton Frazer (date of Com: 8 Octo 1861)
Capt: Isham Boling (date of Com: 8 Octo. 1861)
I have just received a letter from the War Department & send you a copy of the same viz:

"War Department
"Adjutant Generals' Office
"Washington, March 20th 1862.
"Special Order No. 60- Extract-
"4.....The following Volunteer Officers having
"been reported on, adversely, by a Board of Examination, and the President of the United States having approved the report, are discharged the service, to take effect March 15. 1862-

"Colonel Jesse Bayles, 4th Kentucky Vol. Cavalry
"Captain George Walling- 4th " " "
"Captain Casper Blume- 4th " " "
"2d Lieut: Wm M. Nichols- 4th " " "
"By order of the Secretary of War
"(Signed) "L. Thomas
"Adjutant General

"Head Quarters
"Department of the Mississippi
"Saint Louis, March 26, 1862_
"Official "W. H. McLean
"Assistant Adjutant General
"Govenor of Kentucky_"

Resply Yours
John W. Finnell
Adjt Genl
